sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都有"解雇，开除"之意。
means: discharge ： 语气较重，指有理由的解雇，含几乎不再复用的意味。
dismiss ： 正式用词，是这组词中语气最轻的一个词，一般只有从上文才能看解雇的原因或理由。
fire ： 口语用词，多指被断然地突然解雇，其行动犹如开枪一样干净利落。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"开除，驱出，去掉"之意。
means: remove ： 普通用词，不带任何感情色彩。
eliminate ： 通常指例行的、有步骤地去掉某物或某人。
dismiss ： 既可指突然地迅速地排除，也可指解雇或开除。
expel ： 多指强行解除公职或驱出住地。

sentence.Network_en: The Prime Minister has the power to dismiss and appoint senior ministers.
sentence.Network_cn: 首相有权任免高级部长。

sentence.Network_en: I would certainly dismiss any allegations of impropriety by the Labour Party.
sentence.Network_cn: 对于工党指责我行为不正当，我当然不会理会。

sentence.Network_en: They were quick to dismiss rumours of an off-screen romance.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们迅速否认了两人在现实生活中是情侣关系的传言。

list.abs: 英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(D) ... dismiss 解散 dismissal wage 遣散费 dismissal 解雇.
Discriminant Analysis 判别分析dismissal reason 解雇理由disparate impact 差别性影响
1317 disinvestment 负投资,减资1318 dismissal pay 解雇费1319 disposal 清理,变卖
[17]推定解雇(Constructive Dismissal)，也有学者译作实质解雇或变相解雇，指雇主采用种种苛刻条件逼迫雇员主动提出辞职，由此所 …

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from medieval Latin dismiss-, variant of Latin dimiss- 'sent away', from the verb dimittere

entry.def: If you dismiss something, you decide or say that it is not important enough for you to think about or consider.

example.ex: Mr Wakeham dismissed the reports as speculation...
example.tran: 韦克厄姆先生把这些报道当作臆测而不予考虑。

example.ex: I would certainly dismiss any allegations of impropriety by the Labour Party...
example.tran: 对于工党指责我行为不正当，我当然不会理会。

entry.tran: (从头脑中)去除;不再考虑;抛弃
entry.def: If you dismiss something from your mind, you stop thinking about it.

example.ex: I dismissed him from my mind...
'It's been a lovely day,' she said, dismissing the episode.
example.tran: “这是开心的一天，”她说，将那事抛到了脑后。

entry.def: When an employer dismisses an employee, the employer tells the employee that they are no longer needed to do the job that they have been doing.

example.ex: ...the power to dismiss civil servants who refuse to work...
example.tran: 开除拒不上班的公务员的权力

example.ex: The military commander has been dismissed.
example.tran: 军队司令已经被免职了。

entry.tran: 让…离去;把…打发走;解散;遣散
entry.def: If you are dismissed by someone in authority, they tell you that you can go away from them.

example.ex: Two more witnesses were called, heard and dismissed...
example.tran: 又有两个目击者被传唤，提供证言后获准退席。
雇来的马车被打发走了。

entry.def: When a judge dismisses a case against someone, he or she formally states that there is no need for a trial, usually because there is not enough evidence for the case to continue.

example.ex: An American judge yesterday dismissed murder charges against Dr Jack Kevorkian.
example.tran: 昨天一个美国法官驳回了对杰克·凯沃尔基安医生的谋杀指控。

example.ex: ...their attempt to have the case against them dismissed.
example.tran: 想让指控他们的诉讼案被驳回的企图

means.word_mean: 2. cease to consider; put out of judicial consideration;

sentences.sentence: "They dropped her after she had a child out of wedlock"

means.word_mean: 5. end one's encounter with somebody by causing or permitting the person to leave;

sentences.sentence: "I was dismissed after I gave my report"
"The President dissolved the parliament and called for new elections"

Sentence.sentence: Since the 1980s, America has been increasingly clinging to the ideology of uncontrolled free markets and dismissing the role of government---following Ronald Regan's idea that "government is not the solution to our problem; government is the problem.

means.word_mean: 解雇; 撤职; 开除

sentences.en: The new governor dismissed the staff that served his predecessor.
sentences.cn: 新州长将前任州长的职员全部解雇。

sentences.en: He dismissed me from the club.
The pupils were dismissed from school.

means.word_mean: 自心中摒除, 不再考虑或谈论

sentences.en: He dismissed the story as a rumour.
sentences.cn: 他把这个消息当做谣言而不予考虑。

sentences.en: He dismissed the idea as impossible.
sentences.cn: 他认为那个主意不可能而断然拒绝。

jushi.chinese: 咱们别想这些烦人的事了。

jushi.english: He dismissed the idea as suddenly as it had risen.
jushi.chinese: 他的这个念头产生得突然,打消得也突然。
他未得到预先通知就被辞退了。
